title: JSON content used at build time to get Telugu sentences

vemanaReligious.meaning: A single spoonful of milk from a venerable cow is enough.
Of what use is a pailful of donkey's milk?
A single handful of food given with faith is enough.

vemanaMoral.meaning: A lord shouldn't be abandoned, even for a thousand others.
One shouldn't gossip (about him), regardless of his greatness.
A wife shouldn't scorn her husband, regardless of her beauty.

historyOne.meaning: Who is he?
He is Nannayya.
Who is Nannayya?
Nannayya was a poet
Was Nannayya an important poet?
Nannayya was the first Telugu poet.
What did Nannayya do?

historyOne.sentence: nannayya ēṃ cēsāraṃṭe (cēsāru + aṃṭe) oka kāvyamunu vrāsāru.
historyOne.meaning: What Nannayya did is that he wrote a poem.
What poem did Nannayya write?
Nannayya wrote the Āndhra Mahābhāratam.
The poem that Nannayya wrote is the Āndhra Mahābhāratam.
Did Nannayya write the entire (poem)?
Nannayya did not write the entire poem.
Nannayya wrote some of it.

historyOne.sentence: nannayya canipōyiṃtaruvātā vērē kavulu āṃdhramahābhāratamunu pūrticēsāru.
historyOne.meaning: After Nannayya died, other poets finished the Āndhra Mahābhāratam.
Who are those people who finished the Āndhra Mahābhāratam?
They are two people, they are Errana and Tikkana.
Who were Tikkana and Errana?
Tikkana and Errana were poets like Nannayya.
Were they important poet?

historyOne.sentence: tikkana errana āṃdhramahābhāratamunu vrāsāru. vērē kavitvālanu vrāsāru kūḍā.
historyOne.meaning: Tikkana and Errana wrote the Āndhra Mahābhāratam. They also wrote other poems.
What is the Āndhra Mahābhāratam?
The Āndhra Mahābhāratam is a poem.
The Āndhra Mahābhāratam is a great poem.

historyOne.sentence: nannayya tikkana errana āṃdhramahābhāratamunu ē bhāṣa lō vrāsāru?
historyOne.meaning: In what language did Nannayya, Tikkana, and Errana write the Āndhra Mahābhāratam?
Did they write the book in Sanskrit?
Did they write the book in Telugu?

historyOne.sentence: āṃdhramahābhāratamunu telugu lō vrāsāru gāni cānā saṃskṛta padālu vāḍāru. koṃtamaṃdi telugu kavulu aṭla vrāstāru.
historyOne.meaning: They wrote the Āndhra Mahābhāratam in Telugu, but they used a lot of Sanskrit vocabulary. Many Telugu experts write like that.

historyOne.sentence: ā kavulu grāṃthika bhāṣa lō vrāsāru.
historyOne.meaning: Those poets wrote in grāṃthika-bhāṣa (a classical, literary style of writing).
What does 'grāṃthika bhāṣa' mean?

historyOne.sentence: mukhyamaina pustakamulanu vrāsinappuḍu koṃtamaṃdi paṃḍitulu grāṃthika bhāṣa vāḍutāru.
historyOne.meaning: When writing important books and poems, some people use grāṃthika-bhāṣa.
Is grāṃthika bhāṣa easy?
No. Grāmthika bhāṣa is hard.
It is hard to learn grāṃthika bhāṣa.

historyOne.sentence: grāṃthika bhāṣa nērcukovaḍaṃ kaṣṭamainappaṭiki manamu nērcukovāli.
historyOne.meaning: Grāṃthika bhāṣa is hard, but we should still learn it.
Did Nannayya write other poems?
He wrote the āṃdhraśabdaciṃtāmaṇiḥ.
What is the āṃdhraśabdaciṃtāmaṇiḥ about?
The āṃdhraśabdaciṃtāmaṇiḥ is about grammar.
The āṃdhraśabdaciṃtāmaṇiḥ is a grammar book.

historyOne.sentence: nannayya ā graṃdhamunu ē bhāṣa lō vrāsāru?
historyOne.meaning: In what language did Nannayya write that book?
He wrote it in the Sanskrit language.

historyOne.sentence: ā graṃdhamu saṃskṛta bhāṣa lō vrāsāru gāni telugu vyākaraṇamu guriṃci.
historyOne.meaning: That book is written in the Sanskrit language, but it is about Telugu grammar.
Telugu grammar is hard, right?
Therefore, the āṃdhraśabdaciṃtāmaṇiḥ is an important book.

budugu.meaning: This is a picture of me.

budugu.sentence: nā@ pēru buḍugu. iṃko pēru piḍugu. mā bāmma hāri piḍugā aṃṭuṃdi. aṃduku.
budugu.meaning: My name is Budugu. I have another name, Pidugu. My grandma calls me 'Hari Piduga.' That's why.

budugu.sentence: iṃko assalu pēruṃdi. ippuḍu ceppaḍāniki ṭaimu lēdu. adi cālā poḍugu. kāvālistē mā nānnani aḍugu.
budugu.meaning: I have yet another name. There is not enough time to say it right now. It is very long. If you want (to know) it, ask my dad.

rao.sentence: ānāḍu bejavāḍalō akhilabhārata kāṃgres kamiṭī samāvēśaṃ jarigiṃdi. kāṃgres jīvitaṃlō ā samāvēśāniki eṃtō cāritraka prāmukhyaṃ vuṃdi.
rao.meaning: On that day, there was a Congress Committee meeting. That meeting is very historically important in the life of Congress.

rao.sentence: - kāṃgresnu vistṛta prātipadikagala prajāsaṃsthagā rūpoṃdiṃcēṭaṃduku ā samāvēśaṃlōnē nirṇayiṃcāru.
rao.meaning: In that meeting alone, the Congress decided to become a public institution.

rao.sentence: - khaddaru vudyamaṃ, madyaniṣēdhaṃ kāṃgresu kāryakramaṃlō bhāgālugā svīkariṃcabaḍḍāyi.
rao.meaning: Wearing the khaddar and prohibition were adopted into its program.

rao.sentence: - prajala nuṃcē prajōdyamāla nirvahaṇaku dhanaṃ sēkariṃcē nirṇayaṃ tīsukonnāru.
rao.meaning: They decided to collect money to organize a public event.

rao.sentence: ānāṭi nuṃcī muppēṭana jātīyōdyamaṃ telugudēśaṃ nālugu ceragulā alumukuṃdi.
rao.meaning: Since that day, the natoinal movement has struck the Telugu country like four sticks.
